page.title: 11MOTTISTONE VILLAGE AND MANOR
page.content: Mottistone is a very tiny village with a manor house, church and only a few houses. The manor is of Saxon origins and the church belonging to it was built in the fourteenth century.The present manor building was constructed in 1567 but it has been extexnded over the years. An earthquake in 1707 caused a landslide and rubble filled one wing of the house. When this was dug away in the manor's more recent history it was found that the strong walls had withstood all this even though the windows and contents had been ruined. The manor's rooms have very large fire_places and the family evolved a tradition that after the last winter fire the ashes are left in the grate until the first fire of the next winter. The gardens are opened once a year.
